name: Beanie Babies A-Z Quiz Series - E  | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which of these Beanie Babies is a bird?
questions.explanation:
Early.

	Early is a fat bird.  He is a robin, most known for their red chest. "Early is a red breasted robinFor a worm he'll soon be bobbin'Always known as a sign of springThis happy robin loves to sing!"

questions.text: Which of these is is the name of a dolphin?
questions.explanation:
Echo.

	Echo is short for echolocation.  Echolocation is what dolphins use to get around.  It is the same things bats use!  Echolocation is when you make sounds, and those sounds bounce off of objects nearby so you can determine how close they are to you, so you can avoid running into them. "Echo the dolphin lives in the seaPlaying with her friends, like you and meThrough the waves she echoes the sound'I'm so glad to have you around!'"

questions.text: Which of these is a white bear?
questions.explanation:
Eggnog.

	There are several bears with the word 'egg' in their names, but Eggnog is the only one that is white.  He is much different that regular bears, although he sits the same way.  He has a wider face and is a lot shorter, and he wears a large white bow on his neck. "By the fireplace, warm and snug We'll drink some eggnog from a mugLet's give a toast of holiday cheerTo friends and family, far and near!"

questions.text: Which of these is a rabbit?
questions.explanation:
Energizer Bunny.

	The Energizer Bunny is a famous pink rabbit that keeps on going and going, just like Energizer batteries claim to do.  This silly pink rabbit constantly beats on a drum, never stopping, because it runs on the Energizer batteries. "Whether at home, at work or playNothing will get in E.B.'s wayAnd here's one thing that's sure worth knowingThis bunny just keeps going and going!"

questions.text: Which of these Beanie Babies lives in water?
questions.explanation:
Enigma.

	Enigma is a 2000 exclusive.  He is a Loch Ness Monster.  He is green, and has a little ship on his lower left hip, near his tail. "Enigma is my name but where is my home Under the water, is that where I roam ?Do you believe in the myth of Loch Ness Do I exist, that's anyone's guess!"

questions.text: Which of the following ISN'T a real bear?
questions.explanation:
Eucalyptus.

	Eucalyptus is a koala.  Although people call the koala a 'bear,' it isn't really a bear.  It is a marsupial, which means it has a pouch. "Koalas climb with grace and easeTo the top branches of the treesSleeping by day under a gentle breezeFeeding at night on two pounds of leaves!"

questions.text: Which of these is a dog?
questions.explanation:
Elfis.

	Elfis is a wrinkly dog that wears an elf's hat and collar.  He does not wear an elf's smock, as that would not fit him! "If you are good both day and night Then you might see this little sprite Who will bring you good luck and cheer All throughout the coming year!"

questions.text: Which of these is the real name of the white horse?
questions.explanation:
Enchanting.

	Enchanting is a white horse with a pink mane and tail.  She has a longer part of her main that has been braided.  She has a bow on her tail. "A horse as beautiful as meEnchanting everyone I seeWith charm that cannot be deniedCan't help but want me by your side!"

Erin.

	Erin is a green bear from Ireland.  Erin has a white three leaf clover on her chest.  It is to bring her good luck. "Named after the beautiful Emerald IsleThis Beanie Baby will make you smile,A bit of luck, a pot of gold,Light up the faces, both young and old!"

questions.text: Which of these is a lamb?
questions.explanation:
Ewey.

	Ewey is a lamb that has a creamy colored fleece.  She has dark brown hooves and a pink face. "Needles and yarn, Ewey loves to knitMaking sweaters with perfect fitHappy to make one for you and meShowing off hers, for all to see!"
